article.name: Web Add-In Change Log
article.title: Web Add-In Change Log
article.body:
Release Date Description
July 2025

July 2025 - We’ve updated the web add-in infrastructure to introduce a KnowBe4 rebrand and a timeout functionality.

  • New Customers: New customers who have used the Prevent Deployment Center will automatically receive the updated interface and timeout functionality. 
  • Existing Legacy Prevent Customers: A migration project will launch soon. If you want early access, update your web add-in manifest files using your regional link below.
    • US: https://www.knowbe4.com/hubfs/prod-us-manifest.xml 
    • UK: https://www.knowbe4.com/hubfs/prod-uk-manifest.xml 
    • AU: https://www.knowbe4.com/hubfs/prod-au-manifest.xml 
    • EU: https://www.knowbe4.com/hubfs/prod-eu-manifest.xml
  • Timeout Functionality: The web add-in will now default to using the gateway for analysis when performance delays are encountered. This functionality requires existing customers to have a configured Prevent gateway in place. For full details about the Legacy Prevent gateway configuration, see our Prevent - Gateway Configuration article.
Release Date Description
December 2024

December 4, 2024 - We're pleased to announce the latest update to the Egress Web Add-in, which includes the following performance improvements:

  • Resolved an issue where users were experiencing intermittent blank prompts when attempting to send emails.
  • Resolved an issue with the Data Loss Prevention prompt, which displayed malformed category values.
September 2024

September 6, 2024—The web add-in has had a makeover, including functionality changes, to improve your end-user experience. The following changes have been made depending on whether you are a Prevent and/or Protect customer.

Prevent Experience:

  • The shield icon has been removed - email advice is displayed in the task pane and color-coded based on the detected risk.
  • If the task pane is open and a risk is found when composing an email, the red or orange risk section will automatically expand to display risk details.

Protect Experience:

  • Encryption
    • Encryption labels have been renamed to Protection Levels.
  • Large File Transfer (LFT)
    • This can be enabled using a toggle in the task pane.
    • If an end-user has already added attachments to an email and then enables LFT, those attachments will be automatically transferred to LFT.
